But he's the only merchant in the area, so you have to deal with him. He doesn't trust most stalkers with anything, and is frankly rude to most of them. He keeps a shotgun on him just in case, and his mood is as bad as ever.
Great, head to the bunker site.

An old shabby briefcase with a combination lock that's closed. It looks like it won't be possible to open it with improvised means, judging by how secure it is. It's safe to assume that there's something important inside this briefcase.

Hello! We've got a little problem with an expedition that went missing in the Silent Hills. Their signal was lost in the area around the base there. Could you check that place out and see if anything happened to them?
For this specific transmutation you need: Strong Needles and Double Dummy artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Knot and Burning Cotton artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Radioactive Bolt and Rusty Hair artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Toad's Eye and Transparent Ball artifacts.
For this specific transmutation you need: Bagel and Zuda artifacts.
I have a transmuter for artifacts, I'm interested in recipes for it.
Okay, I can sell you recipes for transmutation. Each one will you cost you 1000 roubles. I'll upload the ones you've bought to your PDA.
For this specific transmutation you need: Weak Gravitational and Gravitational artifacts.

This is an experimental artifact crossbreeding device. Developer by scientists at the Lake Yantar laboratory, this device allows the creation of various artifacts - provided that you have the needed recipe for the artifact that you want to create.
A canister filled with gasoline, meant for refueling cars and trucks. It holds a total amount of 15 liters.
Hostage scientist: Someone has come! Is it finally over? Hey, stalker! Are you from the Professor?!

Clear Sky Leader's Note: "The Zone surged and spread in all directions, increasing the size of the affected land at breakneck speed, and the cities caught in the waves of the Emission were dying out, while the territory of the Zone kept growing, expanding in all directions. Across the Earth, people look in horror at the blackened sky, and footage from orbit shows a monstrous black blot that is expanding to swallow up the Earth. When things quieted down, more than 100 square kilometers became desolate. The ground, vegetation, and buildings were covered in black dust. Tons of radioactive dust rose into the air, which was blown by gale-force winds over vast areas, contaminating clean bodies of water and fertile land."
A silver pendant. The Elder gave it to me as a reward for my help.

Diary of a legendary stalker nicknamed Gunslinger. Judging by the worn appearance of the diary, and the fact that there's many entries in it, the owner of this diary has been keeping it for a long time. There are records of attempts to break through to the center of the Zone, some schemes, maps, notes. One journal entry documents a trip to the center of the Zone:

Record #1
"So, the road is scouted, the plan has been made, supplies have been collected, and all of my guns have been cleaned. Thanks to the Doctor, he helped us with medicine and provisions, as we've had a bad time with that lately. I hope it's not all for nothing and we find a clue to what's going on down there. They say that man is wired to be curious and fearful of everything he doesn't know at the same time. But I sense something else, a third thing, something, like a-- a call. 
The important thing is not to forget the main code, 667. That's the most important thing."
A container filled with medical supplies that's meant for the Doctor. It's quite heavy.

This is the Professor from Lake Yantar speaking. In case you haven't heard, there are intense concentrations of psionic radiation at the edge of the swamp. Our workers were doing tests there they just.. disappeared - I don't know what happened to them. The door of the house where the switch is located is coded as we know, and the code is in the possession of another group that was working near the swamp; they left the area due to the Phantasm's strong psionic influence. Maybe they'll come back and one of them will tell you the code.
Message - Sin Leader: Hmm, there he is.. He didn't get far. Finish him, stalker. He's already dead!
SOS: Somebody help! I'm in the house at the swamp!
What do you want?! Get out of here!

Heads of Administration of Rostok plant, Nikolaev O.D. Order I.I. Zyablikov, an employee of the Product Delivery Department, is transferred from the Product Delivery Department to the Research Laboratory No. 6 due to production needs. Date: 10.02.2005 Signed: Nikolaev O.D.
Looks like the plant's human resources department, or some kind of archive.
The Zarya-2 is a flashbang grenade, using blinding light and overwhelming noise to disorientate enemies. These are normally used in hostage rescue or crowd control operations.
A bunch of regular of 5x25mm bolts. These are normally bought fromm hardware stores and used for various DIY repair projects, but in the Zone - these are used by the Gravity Shotgun as ammo.

An anomalous weapon that harnesses the energy of gravitational artifacts, pieced together from various pieces of scrap metal. This weapon uses bolts for ammo, and the high velocity this weapon propels them at makes them incredibly lethal.
 
 Ammunition:
 5x25mm bolts

Secret To the head of the Psi-Barrier project, Prof. Chubko V.M. From the head of the laboratory K.T.S., Prikhodko P.S. "Test unit ZX-16's report on prohibitive modes." The tests were conducted under conditions of forced underestimation by a factor of 2 of the emergency shutdown barrier due to thermal overheating. The ZX-16 unit was activated in its normal psionic-field mode, Perimeter Defense. The tests performed showed the appearance of uncontrollable peak-like bursts of psionic radiation and induced fields after 5-6 minutes of continuous operation. The strength of the psionic-field reached values of 50 to 60 percent higher than the design parameters of the installation. In absolute values, the values are 170-190 psiA. The obtained values are not explained by Kasyanov's theory of induced psionic-fields, since the result of psionic-field lowering at the moment of transmitter overheating was assumed. Part of the staff believes that the increase in the temperature of the transmitter due to overheating leads to an increase in the parameters of neural activity of the biomass of the "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain and the brain becomes a kind of a repeater of psionic radiation, not only a source of psionic waves pumping the transmitter. But this claim requires a serious experimental test, for which the team lacks the resources to do. Others claim that after the experiments - they go crazy and don't think much at all. This is indeed a problem - some of the staff will have to be parted with soon. Biomaterials exposed to psi-fields during the experiment unfortunately became unusable due to irreversible changes in the activity of the brain and central nervous system. CT scan and encephalogram data are attached in a separate report. In spite of unexpected and unpredictable results of the experiment on the ZX-16 installation, the results are intriguing, because they give the right to assert that the use of psionic emitter together with "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain can give, in the end, a more reliable result of the "Psionic-barrier" system than similar results of our competitors from the laboratory. 12.12.2007 Prikhodko P.S. P.S. To continue the research we need a new batch of biomaterials, in the amount of: 10 animal specimens and 10 human specimens from 1296-bis. Please also send additional guards, as it is becoming problematic to hold the prisoners after they've been exposed to psionic radiation. After the last experiment, some of them managed to escape. During the pursuit, the guards managed to eliminate some of them. The rest were driven into a high radiation area and the pursuit was terminated.
To the head of the laboratory, Prikhodko P.S. Pavel Stepanovich, in my opinion, after the experiments, I've noticed that not only some of the employees, but also YOU are starting to lose your mind - you're a fucking moron using our equipment carelessly. Who gave permission to run the brain-emitter complex under uncalculated conditions? Didn't your grandfather work at Chernobyl Unit 4 in 1986? If the staff during the diaster of 1986 fell under the influence of the "Russian Woodpecker" (there is at least some explanation for stupid experiments there), can you imagine how things would go? The disaster would have been far worse. I can find no explanation for your behavior! The manual says, clear as day, that "it is strictly forbidden to increase the psionic power above 120 psiA." Did you forget about this? Damn it! As a result, you lost control of the biomaterial, and moreover - let it escape. Do you realize how hard it is for me to get prisoners for my experiments? Do you realize the danger if ANYONE gets wind of our experiments? I hope you understand. So please, in the future, don't do anything like this without notifying me personally. I understand a young scientist's desire to outrun his competitors, but keep your head up. Speaking of competitors, the lab at their facility yesterday got the psionic emitters running steadily with only TWO cooling shutdowns per day. 8-30 to 9-45 in the morning and 20-12 to 21-00 in the evening. Therefore, the comparison with your mode (5 min. work -3 min. rest) is clearly not in favor of the installation of your laboratory. The Psionic Barrier should work reliably and without any time irregularities during the cooling period. However, I don't want to upset you, I also think that the complex "pseudo-brain - psionic emitter" is more progressive, intelligent, and the future is behind it. But.. a protective barrier is needed now, so at first it is most likely to use the fully man-made version of your colleagues. Yeah, it works like a sledgehammer - bang and no brains. But, as they say, "without noise and dust", cheap and surly. (just kidding). Please pass on my congratulations to the lab staff on a Happy New Year and Merry Christmas. Prof. Chubko V.M. 20.12.2007 P.S. I will make arrangements for the supply of biomaterials shortly.

Laboratory Order. In connection with the catastrophic disaster that began on April 12 of this year in the center of the Exclusion Zone around the Chernobyl NPP, I've issued numerous directives. Directive 1: Laboratory staff must copy lab reports and assemble 4 sets of documents, along with destroying the original classified documents. Directive 2: Security must dispose of all biomaterials. Directive 3: Perform preservation of the laboratory. Directive 4: Prepare to load the experimental program "Shroud of Darkness" into the "Ya-1M" pseudo-brain, as well as the activation of all external tracking sensors. Directive 5: Activate wind turbines and backup power sources, switch the laboratory to an energy-saving mode. Directive 6: Make your way to the main lab in the Z17-45 area in groups of 3. Each group carries 1 set of documents. One guard is assigned to each group. Everybody must wear protective gear. Good luck, everyone. Laboratory Manager Prikhodko P.S., Head of the K.T.S. Laboratory

Posthumous note, dated April 26th, 2008. I, Prikhodko Pavel Stepanovich, head of the laboratory, born in 1976, being in my right mind, voluntarily pass away today. I want to explain the reasons why. I hope someone finds this note and passes it on to my loved ones and my colleagues to whom I remained loyal to until the end. Two weeks ago, I signed a mothballing order for our lab. After the events of April 12, the laboratory could no longer operate normally. Communication with the center was lost. Having reproduced the lab result materials, I sent four groups of my staff to the main lab. Some of them will make it, I believe. And the invaluable results of our work will not go to waste. This will benefit our GREAT cause. After this, I was left alone, and I loaded into our brainchild - the "Ya1-M" pseudo-brain, developed by us, the "Shroud of Darkness" program, which was supposed to make our ZX-16 psionic-defense complex inspire any thinking creature within 200 meters, the absolute invisibility of our laboratory, as well as on a subconscious level to inspire unease and apprehension in anyone who tries to approach it - hopefully preventing them from discovering the lab. Anyway, I'll be brief. I don't know why, but it wasn't the program that worked. When I tried to leave the psionic-protected room with the "brain", I received a intense, psionically-given order to defend the facility and kill all uninvited guests. When I woke up, I found myself back in the psionic shelter. I don't remember how I got back. Over the past 2 weeks that I've spent in this room - I've asked myself thousands of times, how could a program we just started developing work? The answer scares me. Perhaps the most fantastic hypothesis of my colleagues about the possibility of self-learning in Ya-1M worked. If so, that monster is probably grinning slyly at me right now. I tried to smash his hull, but to no avail. My PM can't do anything about that armored glass. And all the machine guns were taken away by our guards. The only way to shut down the complex now is at the backup control panel. I trapped myself. We ran out of water and provisions a week ago. If I leave the room - the psionic radiation will destroy me as a person, and my remaining short days will be spent living the life of an vegetable. I don't want this, so I saved the last bullet in my gun for myself. Good luck to everyone - Pavel. April 26, 2008. 13-40
A device that shows a map of the Cordon with numerous anomalous formations on it.

A device that measures and catalogs anomalous formations, along with documenting their locations accurately on satellite maps. To use this device, you must approach the anomaly, hold the device in your hands, and activate the device.
The dead corpse of a crow. You can eat this, but crows in the Zone are highly radioactive, so eating them is risky. You can cook this over a campfire.

Documents from an abandoned laboratory. They mention experiments carried out in the complex - one specific document that stands out has details related to experiments that lead to the creation of the Burer. There are also monthly reports on the work of scientific departments, lists of all scientific workers, project budgets, instructions for carrying out standard procedures, and so on. There is also talk about transferring the results of experiments to another complex. Judging by the coordinates, it's located somewhere at Yantar.
Digital lighting control. Control codes: 1 - on, 2 - off.
There's a blockage here. You can try to remove it.

A SUPER-series artifact detector. This detector is the one of the latest detectors developed by scientists working in the Zone. Thanks to advancements in nanotechnology, this device's scanning radius has been increased to 1.5 kilometers. This devices designates artifacts when they're detected by giving them markers and putting them on a relevant satellite map so that the user can figure their specific location. This detector also recognizes artifact types, using an artifact encyclopedia stored in the device's memory storage as a reference to check against, making this device the best artifact detector you can get.

A PRO-series artifact detector. This detector is an improved version of the INDY-series artifact detector, developed by scientists working in the Zone looking to improve on the artifact detection device they've developed. This arifact detector works by displaying a satellite map of the local area its user is in and tagging any detected artifacts with markers on the map, giving a precise estimation of their location. Additionally, the PRO-series artifact detector has had its scanning radius increased to 70 meters. Due to its reasonable price and improved performance, this detector is one of the most popular among stalkers in the Zone.

A INDY-series artifact detector. This device was the first artifact detector developed by scientists in the Zone. Its ineffective and outdated if compared to newer detectors because of its short detection radius, which is only 40 meters, and the fact that it only indicates the presence of artifacts with only an audiable beep that increases in intensity when its user gets closer to artifact it has detected. Despite this, this device was revolutionary when it was first introduced years ago, making artifact hunting much easier for stalkers.
Hey, dude! Come over here, we have some business to discuss!
This flashlight isn't working. I think the batteries in it are dead.
Turn off the power to the PSI installation.
The PSI installation's power is turned off.

The data in this PDA has been corrupted, but the audio journal entry in it is mostly intact: "Damn, I think my leg is broken.. it really hurts. Apparently the emitter is holed up in the basement, creating a blockage of psionic radiation. Unless we can get to the emitter's control panel and turn it off, there's no way down!. Shit... The door code is 8620. Good thing the Professor told me, just in case!"

The basic data in this PDA is encrypted, but you've managed to access a few documents concerning information about the lab. One document has details about a group of scientists who went to one of the labs at Lake Yantar to search for equipment. It states: "As we know, the staff left the lab in a disorganized and chaotic fashion - there's a lot of very interesting and useful research equipment, ranging from simple dosimeters and dynamometers to experimental weapons and equipment remained there. We'll probably find technical documentation, reports, maybe personal diaries of specialists. All of this should give at least a little insight into what was going on there. Who knows, maybe the information found there will help us bring about another scientific and technological revolution?" You should look for documents on the first and second levels of the complex, and equipment in the storage rooms. There's also a note from the Professor that says: "Be extremely vigilant and cautious as test specimens number 1 and 2, as well as the Alpha psionic specimen have disappeared. Maybe they're still in the lab."

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying moderately dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection from the anomalous energy and radiation that most artifacts have in the Zone. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying more common and less dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection against the radiation that most artifacts emit - but since this container is a more budget-orientated one, it provides zero protection against the anomalous effects more dangerous artifacts have. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.

A medium-sized scientific container, designed for carrying highly dangerous artifacts. Despite its small size, it provides adequate protection against the intense anomalous energy or radiation that the most dangerous artifacts emit. It's made of special heavy-duty plastic, and its outermost layer is coated with a special metal alloy developed at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar that has the same positive properties of lead - but better. These artifact containers are highly sought after by professional artifact hunters.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains one artifact.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains two artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains three artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains four artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains five artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains six artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains seven artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts. This container contains eight artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
A special scientific container for artifacts.
The dead corpse of a rat. You can eat this, but rats in the Zone are highly radioactive, so eating them is risky. You can cook this over a campfire.

This specific backpack - a military surplus one that's rugged and waterproof, normally comes with the most common and popular stalker suit. You can take it off and use it to make a secret stash in a secluded place.

A semi-automatic shotgun of South African origin, originally designed for hunting big game in the African safari. It's compact and convenient, but it does have the major flaw of spewing hot gas in its user's face whenever the weapon fires. Regardless, it has found its way into the hands of firearm enthusiasts in the Zone.
 
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76mm slug,
 12x76mm dart
Stalker, this is Duty outpost! If you're going to go to the Bar, you can come through.

Oh, what a friendly stalker! You know, Journalist was also kind and helped me. I recall that one time I was at his place.. he told me a story that stuck with me.. oh, I'm getting sidetracked. Anyway, behind the power plant there are various installations that caused that big Emission that hit me years ago. Journalist also mentioned that he's scouring the local neighborhood for important documents that might give hom some clues. He said he wanted to find out what has happened in the Zone.
That's all you remember about Journalist? You don't know anything else?
No, that's all I remember about him. Thank you for your help, I think you'll find what you're looking for.
This device is a personal digital assistant - a small, handheld personal computer that has many uses, such as data management and storage.
Hey, stalker, come here! I'm in the house on the hill.
Stalker, you're in Duty territory. Don't you dare shoot or cause trouble here.
Toad: Messer, I've relocated to a bunker in the hills. Come visit me if you can.

We're thinking of doing a raid at Silent Hills. These dark ones are obviously up to something, so we need to do a little recon. The village to the west of the Hills will give us good cover. There's one problem though - there's a controller there. It must be destroyed.
I need to pick up Toad's box.

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you've made it to nuclear power plant at Chernobyl. If you do decide to sneak inside in order to get to the Monolith, listen... The entrance to the reactor is behind the plant, on the north side. There's a pair of double gates. I hope you know what you're doing.

Stalker, it's Toad. I can't believe you've made it to nuclear power plant at Chernobyl. If you do decide to sneak inside in order to get to the Monolith, listen... The entrance to the reactor is behind the plant, on the north side. There's a pair of double gates. I hope you know what you're doing!
Who the hell is out there?
Quiet, quiet, it's all over now...

You mean the scientist from Yantar? Yeah, he lived here. He disappeared under mysterious circumstances recently. Our guys wanted to check out the apartment, but the door is jammed. One of our guys tried to get to the apartment by walking on top of the wires that lead to it a few times, but he kept falling off. He doesn't want to try again anymore... and it looks like the window's boarded up. I think we're going to have to break the door down, or blow things up.
Find the entrance to the laboratory.
The entrance to the main laboratory is located somewhere in the general vicinity of the Generators. You need to find the entrance to it.
Messer! My equipment indicates are that you are very close to the installation. Be careful!
Unknown Stalker: This area is closed to loners, but if you're here on business, come to our base.
The NPC doesn't have enough money.
Voting is not available on this server.
There are currently no active polls.
This Mossberg Maverick 88 has a fragment of the Gravi artifact embedded inside its barrel, positioned in a specific way that greatly increases the velocity of any bullet that this gun fires.
This anomaly has gotten its name because of the characteristic damage that it inflicts on people or objects when anything enters it. Visually, it resembles a bright purple shimmer in the air.

The anomaly snatches its victims up in the air and spins them at a breakneck speed. The exact nature of the Whirligig remains unknown. The anomaly can be recognized by a light whirlwind of dust above and by body fragments scattered in the vicinity. Victims caught on its outer rim - far enough from the maximum effect zone at the center - can escape the Whirligig with relatively minor injuries.
The origin or nature of this anomaly is not clear. When it comes into contact with human flesh, it causes severe injuries similar to the effects of strong acid.

This anomaly is a concentration of of electromagnetic energy. When at rest, it appears as a dull blue-blue shimmer. When it triggers, it creates a disturbance of the electromagnetic field, which negatively affects any objects that can be damaged by an EMP burst. The damaging effect of an electromagnetic pulsed is caused by the occurrence of induced voltages and currents in various conductors. The effect of EMR manifests itself primarily in electronics, such as PDA's or computers, and radio equipment It does not pose a threat to living beings, but it can seriously damage any electronics within its range. Most often, it is EMP anomaly that causes military helicopters to crash.

One of the most inexplicable phenomena discovered in the Zone. It's not known for certain whether this anomaly causes damage if anything (or anyone) comes into contact with it. There is also no information about the artifacts that it produces. Numerous groups of people are trying to study this anomaly: not only scientists, the black market that was spawned by the Zone is also showing great interest. There are also rumors that anyone who comes into physical contact with this anomaly has their fertility - numerous stalkers have attested this.

This anomaly is one of the more aggressive plant-based hazards that stalkers have encountered. It seems to be mostly composed out of moss. Birthmarks do not have a fixed shape; if anyone - or anything approaches it too closely, it digs into its victim with its shoots, causing serious damage to any exposed skin. Scientists have not yet established what artifacts this anomaly forms.

One of the first anomalies encountered in the Zone. Generally speaking, these half-floral, half-faunal mutants appeared long before the Second Catastrophe. Most probably they are the result of radioactive pollution of the area after the Chernobyl disaster. Still, the fact that the "Grasspers" are mostly encountered in the Agroprom Research Institute area indirectly indicates human influence on their birth. The anomaly itself resembles a huge predator plant like "Sundew" or "Venus flytrap". It can often be encountered by water ponds and other plants tangles, in which the "Grassper" camouflages easily due to its protective coloration. But the anomaly can be effortlessly detected by the great amount of flies near it, which feed on the remains of its victims. The "Grassper" is extremely dangerous - it is very difficult to break free out of its closed tentacles.

One of the first anomalies ever recorded - an unstable gravitational field inflicting shock damage to anyone within its radius. Remains active for a week on average. The amount of damage inflicted changes during its lifetime, ranging from minor bruises, through serious wounds, to instant death. Easy to spot in daylight. Accompanied by air fluctuation above the anomaly, dancing leaves and distinctive crimson-colored stains on the ground. Picked up by all types of detectors, the Springboard can also be revealed by throwing objects into it.

An anomalous formation, roughly 10 meters in diameter, accumulating large quantities of static electricity. When triggered, the anomaly bursts out in dozens of miniature lightnings, causing electric shock nearly always lethal to all living beings. Recognizable by the bluish fog hovering above it in daylight. At nighttime, the "Electro" can be revealed using any type of detector or by throwing metal objects into the anomaly.

One of the Zone's examples of mutated vegetation. Reacts to rapidly approaching living beings by discharging a cloud of projectiles severely injuring uncovered or lightly protected skin upon contact. Does not react to slowly moving targets.

An anomaly of presumably gravitational nature. When triggered, the tremendous power of the Vortex drags everything within the radius of 10-15 meters towards center. Victims drawn into the core have no chance of survival: their bodies are quickly constricted into a tight lump, only to be blown up in a powerful discharge of energy a moment later. The anomaly remains stationary throughout its lifetime (a week on average). Easily recognizable in daylight by the air fluctuation above, dancing leaves, fragments of dismembered corpses lying around and a distinctive dark stain in the center. Highly dangerous at night since it can be revealed only by means of a detector or by throwing metal objects into it.
A harmless anomaly, temporarily negating normal gravity. Manifests itself as an area - usually several meters in diameter - where Earth's gravitational pull is greatly reduced.

This anomaly snatches its victims up in the air and spins them at a breakneck speed. The exact nature of the "Whirligig" remains unknown. The anomaly can be recognized by a light whirlwind of dust above and by body fragments scattered in the vicinity. Victims caught on its outer rim - far enough from the maximum effect zone at the center - can escape the "Whirligig" with relatively minor injuries.
An area of increased radiation - over 50 mR/h. Staying in a radiation zone for longer periods of time is strongly discouraged.

A true miracle of an anomaly: an area several meters in diameter where the time flow is significantly slower than usual. Appears to have no negative effect on human health. However, the "Time Machine" can be very difficult to get out of.

While inactive, this anomaly manifests itself as a barely visible cloud of hot air. When triggered by an object or a living being it instantly heats up to lethal temperatures approaching 1500K. At nighttime, it can be revealed by powerful detectors or by throwing metal objects into the trigger area.
This artifact is an incredibly powerful emitter, emitting a unknown type of psionic energy. It looks like an ordinary lamp.

A strange, heavily contaminated area. Should you wander deeper into it, you will see a shallow lake, crammed shore-to-shore with abandoned equipment and other debris. You can also check out the abandoned Institute and the factory, though the military have been hanging around there quite a lot recently.

The Duty faction have set up camp here and they always welcome stalkers in need of rest. A desert oasis of sorts - a place that's mostly devoid of anomalies and mutants. Be sure to check out the Stalker bar that's under the old department store - it's a meeting point for stalkers from all over the Zone. The bar is run by the local trader, so if you're interested in selling or buying wares apart from the local gossip - that's the place to go to. North of the bar is the military base, with the Garbage to the South.

Always gloomy, always misty and always rainy. Stalkers venturing into the Dark Valley are likely to find valuable artifacts, instant death, or both. A place frequented by some of the most experienced old-timers, though you may also stumble upon some common bandits. There's supposed to be an underground lab around there somewhere, so it might be worth to look for a hidden entrance along the way. No one has returned from there alive though and no one can tell for sure just what nasty surprises await you there.

Think of this place as the Zone's antechamber - it's a good place for rookies to get their head around. You'll find a trader in an basement in the middle of the village, next to the army outpost. Don't miss the chance to talk to him. You'd be advised to steer clear of the outpost itself, however. You don't want the soldiers to catch a sight of you - most of them shoot first and don't bother asking questions later. Yet, as always, there are some who can be bribed as long as the top brass is looking the other way. Attacking the soldiers is not recommended, unless if they pose a direct threat.

A vast machinery graveyard. Right after the first accident whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped there. This part of the Zone is mostly ruins of old buildings infested with mutants. Much like the outskirts of the Zone, the place swarms with rookie stalkers, with an occasional bandit loitering around, always on the lookout for freebies. Some artifacts to be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort. You'll be better off elsewhere. Going North, you will get to the Stalker bar, East lays the entrance to the Dark Valley, with the road to the Agroprom Research Institute to the West.

A deserted army base next to a dilapidated hamlet and a small marsh. A group of religious fanatics known as Sin have settled in the abandoned base. Sin believes in the divine essence of the Zone, believing that the Zone will lead to final redemption of mankind. According to Barkeep, about two weeks ago all the PDAs signals of the stalkers who are part of Sin went offline. Since then, nothing has been heard from them. All stalkers who approached their base disappeared. Most stalkers have speculated that either this group no longer exists, and something else has settled there and is destroying everyone who comes near, or everyone that's part of Sin have completely lost their minds and are attacking everyone.

This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant. It was quite a big place once, now it's ghost town with various mutants and zombies as the only residents. Going through here steathily is ideal unless if you want to get swarmed.

This area used to be the site of a rather large manufacturing plant, currently in ruins. Many stalkers have met their death here, as the place is swarming with all sorts of monsters. The beasts are literally streaming over there from the entire Zone. It's said that something of great importance is hidden at this site, so there are always plenty of daredevils willing to try their luck.

This area used to be the site of a rather large manufacturing plant, currently in ruins. Many stalkers have met their death here, as the place is swarming with all sorts of monsters. The beasts are literally streaming over there from the entire Zone. It's said that something of great importance is hidden at this site, so there are always plenty of daredevils willing to try their luck.

The site of the world-famous nuclear power plant. This is the heart of the Zone. If you believe the legends, this is also the site of the Black Monolith - a mysterious thing capable of granting any wish.

The legendary lake in the sector of the same name dried up a long ago, leaving a shallow swamp in its place. The place is morbid and sodden with death. Great dangers await any adventurous soul foolish enough to get near it. Anyone who dares to go too far goes insane. Zombie drones are rambling around the whole sector, waiting for new victims. The lake itself is poisonous - touching it without protection will lead to nasty acid burns. If you walk around the lake and past the zombies, you’ll end up at the scientists' camp, where the eggheads brought there by choppers are doing some research. You can have a chat with them; they buy artifacts and could even send you on a mission. In the center of the lake there are several large islands made of garbage and the skeletons of buildings. Several paths through shallow water lead to them. The largest one has a descent into an unflooded basement.

Reports are surfacing of strange occurrences within the inner ten-kilometer zone around Pripyat.\nThe city, long forgotten, has recently gained notoriety for sightings of unusual animals roaming its streets at night, with the first cases of missing persons emerging. Following the mysterious disappearance of a bus carrying foreign tourists, the zone was closed to visitors, but extensive investigations have yielded no answers; the bus appears to have simply vanished.\nRecently, locals brought a peculiar red-haired creature with a humanoid form, small stature, and large black eyes to a checkpoint. Officials confiscated the corpse, and, days later, newspapers in the capital dismissed the rumors, claiming it was merely an escaped monkey owned by a maintenance chief.

The Chernobyl Scientific Research Institute of Parapsychology, or CSRIP was established in the Soviet Union; its central research building is located near Chernobyl, but its various departments are scattered throughout the territory of the former USSR. Where did research materials come from on a regular basis? The main goals of CSRIP was study and development of human paranormal abilities. Its priority is to develop a new concept of relations between man and the state, and creation of a new society based on the common consciousness of the working masses. Collectivism of a new level is a full-fledged collective mind, covering all areas of human activity and including all citizens of the allied countries.

Following in the tracks of those foolhardy loners who call themselves the stalkers, research expeditions are once again embarking on an in-depth study of the Zone. However, the perimeter guarded by the army has other, dangerous inhabitants now - from common poachers to the worst bandit scum. Most of the stalkers roam the Zone in search of anomalies and the so-called artifacts for which they gain quite a profit.

Rumors arose among the local population that the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant was home to secret government-owned laboratories, thus leading to the theory the explosion that occurred on April 26th, 1986 was due to an overload during an experiment.
You're too heavily loaded to walk.
Your weapon has jammed. You need to reload.
You can't sleep when enemies are nearby
Press ($$ACTION_USE$$) to enter the code for the door
This device is a prototype, and its intended function seems to be for emitting psionic radiation. Since this device is a unrefined prototype, it has a good chance of malfunctioning.
This suit is a modified NBC suit, giving excellent protection against high levels of radiation. It'll also filter out any radiation from its user's body if it's kept in good working order.
A device that detects the presence of mutants with psionic abilties and shows where they are in a map that updates in real-time in your PDA.

This device is colloquially known as the 'Disintegrator'. Its intended function is to alter the properties of an artifact by activating certain particles in it. One of the specific things it can do is turn an artifact into jelly.

The HEALTH-13 kit is an advanced universal medical kit that is highly adatpable and has many uses, able to treat numerous ailments such as wounds, burns, poisoning, and so on. It also allows you to diagnose various diseases of the body and treat them. The HEALTH-13 kit requires special capsules filled with various drugs in order for it to work fully.
An empty HEALTH-13 kit that needs to be loaded with medical capsules. Special medical capsules are needed for this kit.
These medical capsules are meant for the HEALTH-13 universal medical kit.
A fireproof briefcase that contains documents.
A device that's meant for measuring psionic energy.
A polyethylene file that contains numerous documents.
These documents contain information related to installing the 'Psi-Brain'.

A thick stack of scientific papers that you found at Lab X-18. They all contain words that are hard to parse for the layman, complex formulas and detailed diagrams, so it's difficult to understand any of the material from them.
A heavy wooden box with the words "Explosive" written on it in several languages.
A flash drive is a convenient way to store and transfer information.
A PDA is an indispensable device in the Zone for any stalker, useful for things such as cataloging data or maintaining a journal.
A fireproof briefcase, containing numerous documents.
A rough prototype of a protective device developed by scientists that's meant to protect people from psionic radiation.
A improved prototype protective device developed by scientists that's meant to protect people from psionic radiation.

A EX-04 NBC (nuclear, biological, chemical) suit that was designed from the ground up to give protection against the Zone's many hazards. These suits are normally used by expeditions of scientists and stalker-ecologists collaborating with them.

Built-in air filtration and air conditioning system.
Not designed for combat.
Not designed for long-term use.
Warning: with continuous use it will become damaged and torn.
Level of protection against radiation - high
Level of protection against damage and shock - medium
Level of protection against bullets - low
Level of protection against anomalies - high

An experimental sample of a military exoskeleton. It was never mass-produced due to its very high cost and design flaws, and it gives practically zero protection against ballistic damage or anomalies. Despite this, it's in demand due to its ability to take on the weight of all carried equipment, and therefore small batches are made in underground facilities outside Ukraine. A special battery is needed for this exoskeleton to work.

Level of protection against radiation - average
Level of protection against damage and shock - average
Level of protection against bullets - average
Level of protection against anomalies - average

Stalker suit from the Killer faction. Its design is based on the suit used by the special forces of Western armies. Due to a special treatment of the fabric, the armor has a strengthened stability during the physical movement of its plates. Its protective properties are slightly better then those of the PSZ-7 military bulletproof suits.

Level of protection against radiation - low
Level of protection against damage and shock - medium
Level of protection against bullets - medium
Level of protection against anomalies - low

A regular coat that's made out of of thick cloth that has a hood, a pair of jeans, and a pair of high boots. This set of clothes presumably came from outside the of the border of the Zone. It'll give you some protection against scratches or wounds, but it won't protect you against the Zone's anomalies.

Level of protection against radiation - low
Level of protection against damage and shock - low
Level of protection against bullets - low
Level of protection against anomalies - none

A standard set of military fatigues with a bulletproof vest; the specific bulletproof vest intergrated with a gear rig that's currently used by the Ukrainian Army is known as the 'PSZ-7' (Personal Protection System). It gives protection against bullets and grenade fragments, but it won't protect you against anomalies at all.

An EXP-4 scientific protective suit with an airtight red helmet. It weighs around 11 kilograms, and it protects the body from heat, acidic gases, a variety of anomalies (including "Burnt Fuzz"), and mechanical damage. Equipped with two oxygen cylinders. Level of protection against radiation - high Level of protection against damage and shock - medium Level of protection against bullets - low Level of protection against anomalies - high

Features: Protects from fire, acid, gases, from various abnormal influences and burning fluff. Increases protection from physical damage. Carries two oxygen cylinders. Specifics: with prolonged use it becomes unusable - damaged and torn.

A protective suit, made by local craftsmen in the Zone. It has a special coating that protects against acidic anomalies, and gives decent protection against ballistic damage and trauma. It doesn't give more complete protection against anomalies and radiation if compared to more professionally-made protective suits since it lacks an airtight helmet. Level of protection against radiation - average Level of protection against damage and shock - average Level of protection against bullets - average Level of protection against anomalies - average

A protective suit, made by local craftsmen in the Zone. It has a special coating that protects against acidic anomalies, and the back and front have special bio-metal plates. It also gives decent protection against ballistic damage and trauma, and it also comes with an airtight helmet, giving its user good protection against radiation. These suits also normally come with two cylinders on the back filled with oxygen for its rebreather system. Unfortunately, this suit gives little protection against armor-piercing rounds and it'll get worn down quickly by them. Level of protection against radiation - average Level of protection against damage and shock - average Level of protection against bullets - average Level of protection against anomalies - average

This suit was designed to give protection for scientists working in the Zone. It's equipped with a closed breathing circuit system, as well as a built-in system for suppressing the effects of anomalies, giving its user excellent protection against anomalies. This suit also has a built-in container for carrying artifacts. The only real downside this suit has is that it gives nearly no protection against ballistic damage. Level of protection against radiation - high Level of protection against damage and shock - medium Level of protection against bullets - low Level of protection against anomalies - high
